sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些词均有"在……后面"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: after, behind, at the back of
means: after和behind用来表地点时，前者强调的是顺序的先后，而后者侧重方向和位置的前后关系。请比较：The student sat after me.那个学生坐在我后面。(我坐在他前面)。The student sat behind me.那学生坐在我背后。after与behind用于指时间时，前者强调时间的先后顺序，而后者则着重于表示"落后……"或"迟于……"的概念。试比较：Who ruled after James I?詹姆斯一世之后是谁统治的?You are forty minutes behind schedule.你比规定的时间迟了40分钟。after多用于表示因时间上的先后而造成顺序的前后场合，behind则常用于仅指位置上的前后关系。请比较：Please shut the door after you.请随手关门。Please shut the door behind you.请关上你身后的门。
at the back of ：这个前置词短语既可指具体的位置的先后，又可用于指抽象的概念。

entry.def: If something happens after a particular date or event, it happens during the period of time that follows that date or event.

example.ex: After 19 May, strikes were occurring on a daily basis...
example.tran: 5月19日之后，每天都会发生罢工。

example.ex: After breakfast Amy ordered a taxi...
example.tran: 早饭后，埃米预订了一辆出租车。

entry.def: If you do one thing after doing another, you do it during the period of time that follows the other thing.

example.ex: After completing and signing it, please return the form to us in the envelope provided.
example.tran: 填完表格并签名后，请装进所提供的信封里寄还给我们。

example.ex: ...women who have changed their mind after deciding not to have children...
example.tran: 决定不生孩子后又改变主意的女性

entry.def: You use after when you are talking about time. For example, if something is going to happen during the day after or the weekend after a particular time, it is going to happen during the following day or during the following weekend.

example.ex: She's leaving the day after tomorrow.
example.tran: 她打算后天离开。

example.ex: ...the party's annual conference, to be held the week after next.
example.tran: 将在下下周举行的该党的年会

entry.def: If you go after someone, you follow or chase them.

example.ex: He walked out, and Louise went after him.
example.tran: 他走了出去，路易丝也跟着出去了。

example.ex: ...people who were after him for large amounts of money.
example.tran: 为了大笔钱而追随他的人们

entry.def: If you are after something, you are trying to get it.

example.ex: They were after the money...
example.tran: 他们想得到这笔钱。

example.ex: I did eventually find what I was after.
example.tran: 我最终找到了我想要的东西。

entry.def: If you call, shout, or stare after someone, you call, shout, or stare at them as they move away from you.
entry.tran: 朝着（正离去之人喊叫或注视）

example.ex: 'Come back!' he called after me...
example.tran: “回来！”他朝我喊道。

example.ex: Claire stared after him until he disappeared around a corner.
example.tran: 克莱尔一直注视着他，直到他消失在拐角。

entry.def: If you do something after someone, you do it for them, because they cannot or will not do it for themselves.

example.ex: She used to mess up the floor and I had to clean up after her.
example.tran: 她过去常常把地板弄得很脏乱，而我不得不为她清理干净。

entry.def: If you tell someone that one place is a particular distance after another, you mean that it is situated beyond the other place and further away from you.

example.ex: A few kilometres after the village, turn right to Montelabate.
example.tran: 过了村庄之后再前行几公里，向右转前往蒙特拉贝特。

entry.def: If one thing is written after another thing on a page, it is written following it or underneath it.

example.ex: I wrote my name after Penny's.
example.tran: 我把自己的名字写在彭尼的下面。

entry.def: You use after in order to give the most important aspect of something when comparing it with another aspect.

example.ex: After Germany, America is Britain's second-biggest customer...
example.tran: 对于英国来说，美国是仅次于德国的第二大客户。

example.ex: Methane is often regarded as the second most important greenhouse gas after carbon dioxide.
example.tran: 甲烷常被认为是仅次于二氧化碳的重要温室气体。

entry.def: To be named after someone means to be given the same name as them.
entry.tran: 依照，按照（某人的名字命名）

example.ex: Phillimore Island is named after Sir Robert Phillimore...
example.tran: 菲利莫尔岛以罗伯特·菲利莫尔爵士的名字命名。

example.ex: He persuaded Virginia to name the baby after him.
example.tran: 他说服弗吉尼娅以他的名字为婴儿取名。

entry.def: If you say 'after you' to someone, you are being polite and allowing them to go in front of you or through a doorway before you do.
entry.tran: （走路或出入门口时的礼貌用语）您先请

example.ex: 'After you.' — 'Not at all, Mr Bird, after you.'
example.tran: “您先请。”——“别客气，伯德先生，您先请。”

entry.def: After is used when telling the time. If it is, for example, ten after six, the time is ten minutes past six.
If you do something to several things one after the other or one after another, you do it to one, then the next, and so on, with no break between your actions.

example.ex: Sybil ate three biscuits, one after the other...
example.tran: 西比尔接连吃了3块饼干。

example.ex: Caroline was trying on one outfit after another.
example.tran: 卡罗琳一套接一套地试穿衣服。

entry.def: If something happens day after day or year after year, it happens every day or every year, for a long time.

example.ex: I waited for news, day after day, expecting to hear.
example.tran: 我日复一日地等着，期待能听到消息。

example.ex: ...people who'd been coming here year after year.
example.tran: 年复一年到这里来的人们
